Siobhan Redmond judges = voices = | narrated = theme_music_composer = opentheme = endtheme = composer = country = | United Kingdom language = English num_seasons = 2 num_episodes = 20 | list_episodes = executive_producer = producer = editor = location = Greater | Manchester, England cinematography = camera = runtime = 60 minutes company = | Granada Television distributor = channel = ITV picture_format = audio_format = | first_run = first_aired = 5 June 1985 last_aired = 8 August 1987 status = | Ended preceded_by = followed_by = related = website = production_website = }} 'Bulman' is a Granada TV series which ran from 1985–1987 and followed the fortunes of the major character from the earlier [[The XYY Man|XYY Man]] and [[Strangers (TV series)|Strangers]] series. Bulman was based - increasingly loosely - on the character featured in the [[The XYY Man|XYY Man]] novels by Kenneth Royce. In this incarnation, Don Henderson appeared again as former Detective Chief Inspector George Bulman, ostensibly retired from police work and repairing old clocks but active as a private investigator, with Lucy McGinty (played by Siobhan Redmond) as his (Scottish) assistant (the character was intended to be Irish, with a line explaining her accent added once Redmond was cast). They are frequently drawn into the clandestine world of the secret service through the machinations of security chief Dugdale (Thorley Walters) or Bulman's one-time police boss Lambie (Mark McManus).
